regulations.templatetags package¶

Submodules¶

regulations.templatetags.in_context module¶

class regulations.templatetags.in_context.InContextNode(nodelist, subcontext_names)[source]¶

Bases: django.template.base.Node

render(context)[source]¶
regulations.templatetags.in_context.in_context(parser, token)[source]¶

Replaces the context (inside of this block) for easy (and safe) inclusion of sub-content.

For example, if the context is {‘name’: ‘Kitty’, ‘sub’: {‘size’: 5}}

1: {{ name }} {{ size }} {% begincontext sub %} 2: {{ name }} {{ size }} {% endcontext %} 3: {{ name }} {{ size }}
Will print
1: Kitty 2: 5 3: Kitty

Arguments which are not dictionaries will ‘cascade’ into the inner context.
